*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Matamoros, June 20, 1832. Advice for res coring order in Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Libiary, Galveston, Tex ]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. M. Williams*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Dr Sir We have a wild account of difficulties at *location_mentioned*Anahuac*/location_mentioned*. The course to be taken is a very simple and plain one. Let a full statement of all the facts be made out judicially keeping certified judicial records, and send them on to the *person_mentioned*Chief of Department*/person_mentioned*. This is the only legal and correct course, and it will put all things right. The reign of *person_mentioned*military power*/person_mentioned* is over I think, and justice may now speak openly and plainly—let a copy of the facts be published in the *location_mentioned*paper*/location_mentioned*—but treat the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, and the *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*with respect—even when the latter have to be censured, let it be in mild and very decorous language. Nothing inflamatory or passionate. But above all things keep down popular commotions and all [acts] of violence. I know nothing of this new cause of difficulty, but suppose that there has very likely been some imprudence on one side—and some acts of hasty and passionate violence by *person_mentioned*Bradburn*/person_mentioned*— the fact is he is incompetent to such a command and is half crazy part of his time.*/p*
*p*Keep peace and harmony at all hazards. Now is a critical time— it is said that a new and liberal party are getting up, pray try and keep the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*there from any acts that may be construed into opposition to the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, for that will turn all parties against us.*/p*
*p*I leave in a few days for *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*where I expect to hear from you. I wrote you from *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*just before I left I think on *date_mentioned n="05-8-1832">8 May */date_mentioned*and enclosed a number of papers of value to others—also from *location_mentioned*Victoria*/location_mentioned*, and *date_mentioned n="06-19-1832">yesterday */date_mentioned*from here by *person_mentioned*Mr. Greaves.*/person_mentioned* I also gave *person_mentioned*John W. Moore*/person_mentioned* an order on you for fifty, and one to *person_mentioned*Greaves */person_mentioned*for one hundred fifty dolls also I send in the [word illegible] and mules and two horses.*/p*
*p*Nothing new from *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*—nothing as to the *person_mentioned*new Ministers*/person_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Genl Teran*/person_mentioned* is at the *location_mentioned*Hacienda de buena vista del Cojo 20 leagues from Tampico*/location_mentioned*. When I left him on the *date_mentioned n="05-31-1832">31 of May*/date_mentioned* he expressed himself very favourable to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*—tho. he was overwhelmed with troubles and Consejos— also I wrote you the other day by a *person_mentioned*[milit?]ary correo.*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*Prudence and harmony and legal proceedings—no violence*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**date_mentioned n="06-20-1832">June 20. 1832 */date_mentioned* Matamoros*/p*
*/div1*
